channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Oh Wow, ‘Scream 7’ Sucks
item.description: Neve Campbell returns to the horror franchise, along with Courteney Cox, Jasmin Savoy Brown, and Mason Gooding.

item.title: Pour les 30 ans de Pokémon, Nintendo ressuscite la Game Boy… en jukebox 8 bits
item.description: Il y a 30 ans, le 27 février 1996, Nintendo lançait sur Game Boy un nouveau jeu (ou plutôt deux) qui allait devenir la franchise la plus lucrative de l'histoire : Pokémon Rouge et Bleu ! Et pour fêter cet anniversaire, quoi de mieux que de se remémorer les mélodies 8 bits du jeu original…

item.title: Pourquoi votre score de sommeil est probablement faux : on vous explique tout ça en vidéo
item.description: Vous vous réveillez épuisé alors que votre montre affiche un score de sommeil parfait de 90 sur 100 ? Ce paradoxe fréquent s’explique par les limites techniques des capteurs actuels, que nous vous expliquons dans une vidéo dédiée.

item.title: Here’s your first look at Kratos and Atreus in Amazon’s upcoming God of War TV adaptation
item.description: With the likes of The Last of Us and Fallout out of the way for a bit, Amazon has seized its opportunity to put the spotlight on the next big video game adaptation, its currently-in-production God of War show. Today we got our first look at Ryan Hurst and Callum Vinson as Kratos and Atreus. The image released by Amazon shows the eponymous God of War standing next to a tree as he watches his son — who notably looks a bit younger than the video game version of 11-year-old Atreus we first met in 2018’s God of War — take aim with his bow. Exactly what they’re hunting is unclear, but we know that ...

item.title: AI music generator Suno hits 2M paid subscribers and $300M in annual recurring revenue
item.description: Suno lets users create music using natural language prompts, making it possible for people with little experience to generate audio with little effort.

item.title: Sennheiser RS 275 : ce tout nouveau casque TV ultra-endurant avec Auracast s’allège déjà de 30 euros
item.description: Sennheiser vient tout juste de lancer son nouveau bundle RS 275 Auracast, qui comprend un casque audio très léger et un transmetteur pour diffuser le son d'une source sur une large zone à la maison. Actuellement, vous pouvez trouver ce pack à 219,99 euros au lieu de 249,99 euros chez Rakuten.

item.title: Apple and Netflix team up to air Formula 1 Canadian Grand Prix
item.description: As Netflix continues its live sports push, the company has partnered with Apple to air the Formula 1 Canadian Grand Prix.

item.title: AI vs. the Pentagon: killer robots, mass surveillance, and red lines
item.description: Can AI firms set limits on how and where the military uses their models? Anthropic is in heated negotiations with the Pentagon after refusing to comply with new military contract terms that would require it to loosen the guardrails on its AI models, allowing for “any lawful use,” even mass surveillance of Americans and fully […]

item.title: I found a great OLED monitor deal for creatives: 27-inch Gigabyte QHD 280Hz delivers stunning color, deep blacks, and ultra-smooth performance — and it’s $100 off with this code
item.description: This Gigabyte 27-inch QHD OLED monitor deal lets creatives step up to 280Hz performance, for $100 less.

item.title: Quelle trottinette électrique Xiaomi choisir ? Tout savoir sur la gamme
item.description: Avec désormais sept modèles à son catalogue, Xiaomi propose une gamme variée de trottinettes électriques, aussi bien en termes de performances que de prix. Mais laquelle choisir ? Notre sélection est là pour vous guider.

item.title: Woot’s ‘Video Games for All’ sale features some of our favorite games
item.description: There’s a sale happening at Woot that’s delivering Black Friday-esque deals on video games through March 5th. The “Video Games for All” sale includes discounts on physical games for most modern consoles, making it a great time to treat yourself (or a pal) to some titles that you’ve been waiting to see big price drops […]

item.title: « Nous n’inclurons jamais d’avis généré par une IA » : Metacritic prévient après une polémique autour de Resident Evil Requiem
item.description: Suite à la découverte d'avis clairement écrits par une intelligence artificielle, le site Metacritic prend une position ferme.

item.title: Sony confirms Resident Evil Requiem is the first game to use the PS5 Pro's updated PSSR upscaler tech — 'The upgraded PSSR has allowed us to elevate our expressiveness by successfully processing these details and textural particularities', says Capcom
item.description: Resident Evil Requiem is the first game to use the PS5 Pro's updated PSSR upscaler tech, Sony has confirmed.

item.title: Le HDR10 revient sur Disney+ Premium, mais les autres formats HDR restent suspendus
item.description: Après plusieurs semaines de restriction, Disney+ semble avoir réactivé le HDR10 sur son offre Premium en Allemagne, tout en maintenant la suspension de Dolby Vision et HDR10+ à la suite d’un litige de brevets avec InterDigital.

item.title: OpenAI secures another $110 billion in funding from Amazon, NVIDIA and SoftBank
item.description: OpenAI just announced a massive funding round of $110 billion, which is one of the biggest investment rounds in Silicon Valley history. The investors feature many of the usual suspects, including Amazon with $50 billion, NVIDIA with $30 billion and SoftBank with $30 billion. This investment brings OpenAI to a $730 billion valuation "We’re super excited about this deal," OpenAI CEO Sam Altman told CNBC. "AI is going to happen everywhere." That last statement seems more like a threat than a boast, but I digress. Beyond the funding round, OpenAI has announced strategic partnerships with both NVID...

item.title: Scientists Injected Stem Cells Into Fetuses to Treat a Birth Defect. Here’s What Happened
item.description: In a Phase I trial, the treatment appeared to be safe in children with spina bifida.

item.title: Perplexity’s new Computer is another bet that users need many AI models
item.description: Perplexity Computer, in the company’s words, "unifies every current AI capability into a single system."

item.title: In a 600-word X post, Jack Dorsey justifies his decision to lay off 40% of Block’s workforce
item.description: The all-lowercase public letter to staff elaborates on why Dorsey slashed headcount at the fintech company by thousands—to embrace AI. On Thursday, Block CEO Jack Dorsey announced that his fintech company, which owns Square and Cash App, would be laying off a whopping 40% of its workforce, slashing over 4,000 jobs.

item.title: ‘Pokémon Winds and Waves’ are coming to the Nintendo Switch 2 in 2027
item.description: The tenth generation starter Pokémon were revealed in the trailer: Browt (a grass bird), Pombon (a fire puppy), and Gecqua (a water gecko).

item.title: How to watch David: King of Israel — stream from anywhere in the world
item.description: The legendary rise of David, guided by faith and courage alone. Here's how to watch David: King of Israel online from anywhere

item.title: Ransomware payments drop to record low, even as attacks surge
item.description: Fewer businesses are paying, but ransomware groups are growing in number.

item.title: Everything we learned from the Pokémon Winds and Pokémon Waves official announcement trailer
item.description: Here’s everything we currently know about Pokémon Winds and Pokémon Waves thanks to the announcement trailer.

item.title: Le téléobjectif du Galaxy S26 Ultra a changé, mais pas forcément en mieux
item.description: Samsung n'a pas réellement changé le hardware des capteurs photo des Galaxy S depuis des années. Sur le S26 Ultra, il y a pourtant une nouveauté. Sauf qu'elle ne va pas plaire à tout le monde.

item.title: NASA overhauls Artemis program, delaying Moon landing to 2028
item.description: NASA is making major changes to its Artemis Moon program. On Friday, Administrator Jared Isaacman announced the space agency would carry out an additional flight in 2027 to test commercial lunar landers from SpaceX and/or Blue Origin. The new mission will take the place of Artemis 3, which previously would have seen NASA attempt to land on the Moon for the first time since 1972. The flight will also see the agency test a new spacesuit made by Axiom Space. As part of the new plan, the redesigned Artemis 3 mission will give NASA the chance to test at least one lander in the relative safety of...

item.title: Burger King is making 3 changes to the Whopper. The most important change has nothing to do with the taste
item.description: Drowning in a sea of complaints over the last few years, the fast food chain came up with a few modifications that hopefully won’t increase the price. In recent months, fans of Burger King appear to have fallen out of love with the chain’s signature sandwich, the Whopper.

item.title: The Pentagon Wants X-Ray Vision to Spot Hidden Threats From 3,280 Feet
item.description: The futuristic tech, funded by DARPA, would allow the U.S. military to preemptively detect danger from a remarkably long distance.

item.title: Best Buy is clearing out OLED TVs ahead of 2026 releases — here are 7 deals I’d recommend without hesitation
item.description: Best Buy is offering its lowest price yet on OLED TVs as it makes room for new 2026 models, and I'm rounding up the 7 best deals that I recommend.

item.title: Samsung Might Not Make Another Galaxy Z TriFold Anytime Soon
item.description: Or another ultra-thin phone, either.

item.title: 86 New Sci-Fi, Fantasy, and Horror Books Arriving in March
item.description: It's almost spring, and there are plenty of enticing new genre titles on the way.

item.title: À peine sortis les écouteurs Samsung Galaxy Buds 4 sont déjà en promo, une vraie opération séduction
item.description: Ils sont sur le marché depuis le 25 février 2026 et pourtant Amazon propose déjà 30 euros de moins sur les Samsung Galaxy Buds 4 qui passent de 179,99 euros à 149,99 euros.

item.title: Employees at Google and OpenAI support Anthropic’s Pentagon stand in open letter
item.description: While Anthropic has an existing partnership with the Pentagon, the AI company has remained firm that its technology not be used for mass domestic surveillance or fully autonomous weaponry.

item.title: Xiaomi nous prépare une surprise électrique pour le MWC : voici ce que l’on sait
item.description: À quelques heures de l'ouverture du MWC de Barcelone, Xiaomi vient d'annoncer qu'un "one more thing" sera dévoilé lors de sa conférence. Le teaser mystérieux cacherait le concept d'une voiture électrique ultra performante, créée avec le jeu vidéo Gran Turismo.

item.title: Plot twist — Netflix ditches Warner Bros deal as insiders call imminent Paramount takeover a ‘gut punch’
item.description: Netflix has decided to concede to Paramount in the battle for Warner Bros. Discovery.

item.title: Galaxy S26 Ultra : Samsung tente d’expliquer un étonnant retour en arrière
item.description: Le Galaxy S26 Ultra abandonne le cadre en titane pourtant si plébiscité sur ses prédécesseurs et revient au bon vieil aluminium. Voici comment Samsung explique cela.

item.title: We don’t have to have unsupervised killer robots
item.description: It's the day of the Pentagon's looming ultimatum for Anthropic: allow the US military unchecked access to its technology, including for mass surveillance and fully autonomous lethal weapons, or potentially be designated a "supply chain risk" and potentially lose hundreds of billions of dollars in contracts. Amid the intensifying public statements and threats, tech workers […]...

item.title: The ‘time is money’ mantra is a terrible starting point for planning and designing infrastructure
item.description: It’s a serious mistake to overplay the economic claims. Productivity, and alleged lost productivity, has driven most of the conversation around traffic congestion and sprawl in the United States. While “time is money” is true in some contexts, it’s a terrible starting point for planning transportation systems.

item.title: Jack Dorsey’s Block Cut Half Its Staff, and He Says Other Tech Firms Will Follow Soon
item.description: Dorsey claimed that AI made the layoffs inevitable but later admitted he over-hired during covid.

item.title: Microsoft signs up Asus and Dell to join the Cloud PC party - powerful new mini PCs and desktops coming later in 2026
item.description: Two new compact PCs are launching as Windows 365-only devices, offering alternatives to the Windows 365 Link.

item.title: Spaceship vs DreamHost: Which host is best for beginners?
item.description: Spaceship vs DreamHost: Which host is best for beginners?

item.title: Sony’s Upscaler Could Make PS5 Pro the Console It Should Have Been at Launch
item.description: The PSSR update finally fulfills PlayStation's promise of getting ray tracing on consoles at 60 fps.

item.title: Wall Street Has AI Psychosis
item.description: A “thought experiment” about the impacts of AI sent stocks tumbling earlier this week. It’s probably going to keep happening.

item.title: 'It's nice to see another element of the show': Bridgerton star on why that brutal season 4 part 2 death needed to happen
item.description: Nobody should have to die in a Netflix romantic drama, but especially not in Bridgerton season 4 part 2. Now it's happened, one star still thinks it was the right decision.

item.title: CISA replaces acting director after a bumbling year on the job
item.description: The U.S. cybersecurity agency's acting director Madhu Gottumukkala will be replaced, after a year of cuts, layoffs, and staff reassignments, and allegations of security lapses and claims he struggled to lead the agency.

item.title: Un tsunami va frapper le marché du smartphone cette année
item.description: Plus dure sera la chute sur le marché du smartphone. La fringale de mémoire des grands acteurs de l'IA va faire mal aux constructeurs de téléphones, selon une nouvelle étude qui prévoit des livraisons en contraction de quasiment 13 % cette année.

item.title: The new second shift is burning out both parents
item.description: Nobody’s workload has gotten lighter. It’s just doubled. Moms may still carry the mental load, but dads are tired, too. The other night, I heard cabinets opening in the kitchen and the shuffling of bags and containers. My husband was looking for snacks with our 9-year-old. After, he got him ready for bed, read him a book, and ordered us dinner. Then he sat down at his laptop and worked until 9 p.m. As I unloaded the dishwasher, I realized two things. First: My husband was killing it. Second: The second shift isn’t women’s work anymore. It’s everyone’s burnout....

item.title: Celebrate Pokémon’s 30th anniversary with this Game Boy-shaped music player
item.description: Pokémon celebrates its 30th anniversary today, and as you’d expect, Nintendo and The Pokémon Company are cranking up the nostalgia in every possible way. In addition to re-releasing the Game Boy Advance remakes of Pokémon Red and Blue on Nintendo Switch Online, they’re also selling us a Game Boy-shaped portable Pokémon jukebox. Officially titled the Pokémon Game Music Collection, the little music player is palm-sized and can be loaded up with 45 different cartridges, each featuring a different melody or sound effect from the original games' soundtrack. The device was announced by longtime seri...

item.title: Get the 65-inch Samsung The Frame Pro for $600 less at Amazon
item.description: As of Feb. 27, you can get the 65-inch Samsung The Frame Pro LED Smart TV (LS03FW, 2025) for $1,497.99, down from $2,097.99, at Amazon.

item.title: The US military reportedly shot down a CBP drone with a laser
item.description: The US military mistakenly shot down a drone belonging to Customs and Border Protection near the Mexican border in Fort Hancock, Texas, according to reports from Reuters and The New York Times. The Thursday incident reportedly led the Federal Aviation Administration to close the airspace where the military fired the anti-drone laser. This marks the […]...

item.title: Pokémon turns 30: What’s behind the media franchise’s enduring appeal?
item.description: Heather Cole, who teaches game design at West Virginia University, says Pokémon offers a masterclass in character design. Benson Lu’s life revolves around Pokémon.The 26-year-old has played the mobile game Pokémon Go every day for a decade, watches the animated show every week, goes to the local card shop in his Los Angeles suburb to play the brand’s trading card game every week, and has a whopping collection of cards worth more than $70,000.“I don’t remember when was the last day I did not think about Pokémon at all,” he said.In the 30 years since Pokémon debuted in Japan with the 1996 releas...
